summary:
Well, I haven’t drawn for a long time, so I’ve started another one! 😊
No pencil ✏️, only graphite powder and blending sticks, I...
body:
Well, I haven’t drawn for a long time, so I’ve started another one! 😊

No pencil ✏️, only graphite powder and blending sticks, I want to know how it turns out and how it can be used efficiently! 😄

reblog.comment:

summary:
NEW TRAILER: Camping Starring David Tennant & Jennifer Garner Comes To HBO In October 

HBO has released a full trailer for the...
caption:
NEW TRAILER: Camping Starring David Tennant & Jennifer Garner Comes To HBO In October

HBO has released a full trailer for the new comedy series Camping which premieres in the USA on October 14th. Camping stars Jennifer Garner and David Tennant as Kathryn and Walt, a not-so-happily married couple. A meticulously planned outdoor trip to celebrate Walt’s 45th birthday is derailed by uninvited guests and forces of nature, turning the weekend into a test of marriage and friendships.  

Camping comes from Lena Dunham and Jenni Konner, the team behind Girls and is based on the UK show of the same name, created by Julia Davis, who acts as executive producer on the HBO reworking. The eight-part limited series also stars Juliette Lewis, Arturo Del Puerto, Ione Skye, Janicza Bravo, Bridget Everett and Brett Gelman.

The show is set to reach a worldwide audience with premieres already confirmed for HBO in Spain and Scandinavia and on OCS City in France from October 15th and HBO Latin America from November 11th. The show will also begin on Sky Atlantic in the UK from October, with the start date to be confirmed.

summary: Moths are the ones that freak me out. It’s something to do with the way that, if they get squashed, they turn to dust. There’s...
text: Moths are the ones that freak me out. It’s something to do with the way that, if they get squashed, they turn to dust. There’s something very wrong about that. It all feels a bit Gothic.

tags: david talking about how 'old' he was cracks me up
because I think he looks like a child here
and was a really great Romeo
summary:
David Tennant as Romeo in the Royal Shakespeare Company’s Romeo and Juliet (2000) - Part Four    

David Tennant on playing...
caption:
David Tennant as Romeo in the Royal Shakespeare Company’s Romeo and Juliet (2000) - Part Four  

David Tennant on playing Romeo (excerpt from Players of Shakespeare 5: Further Essays in Shakespearean Performance by Players with the Royal Shakespeare Company):

How old did you imagine your Romeo to be?

I think Alex [Gilbreath, who played Juliet] and I both felt we were at the far end of being able to get away with it, but it’s more difficult for Juliet because her age is stated so explicitly. Strictly speaking, Romeo could be any age, in that there’s no textual evidence to suggest exactly how old he is, but of course there’s something in the character which suggests teenage angst and perhaps hotheadedness. I didn’t focus too specifically on an age because i was twenty-nine when I did it, and i didn’t want to spend the whole production feeling like I was trying to play a teenager.  I didn’t want that to be my focus. So I kept it, even to myself, slightly vague. I suppose I thought of him as a young man, and beyond that I didn’t spend too much time worrying about exactly how old he was. I think as human beings we tend not to focus on what age we are when we’re having whatever experiences it is that we’re having. So I tried not to make it too big an issue, which was perhaps partly my own fear of being slightly too old to be playing it.

Photo credits include:  Shakespeare Birthplace Trust, photostage.co.uk, the Royal Shakespeare Company, and more

Other Posts in this Set:  [ One ] [ Two ] [ Three ]

I think Alex [Gilbreath, who played Juliet] and I both felt we were at the far end of being able to get away with it, but it’s more difficult for Juliet because her age is stated so explicitly. Strictly speaking, Romeo could be any age, in that there’s no textual evidence to suggest exactly how old he is, but of course there’s something in the character which suggests teenage angst and perhaps hotheadedness. I didn’t focus too specifically on an age because i was twenty-nine when I did it, and i didn’t want to spend the whole production feeling like I was trying to play a teenager.  I didn’t want that to be my focus. So I kept it, even to myself, slightly vague. I suppose I thought of him as a young man, and beyond that I didn’t spend too much time worrying about exactly how old he was. I think as human beings we tend not to focus on what age we are when we’re having whatever experiences it is that we’re having. I think Alex [Gilbreath, who played Juliet] and I both felt we were at the far end of being able to get away with it, but it’s more difficult for Juliet because her age is stated so explicitly. Strictly speaking, Romeo could be any age, in that there’s no textual evidence to suggest exactly how old he is, but of course there’s something in the character which suggests teenage angst and perhaps hotheadedness. I didn’t focus too specifically on an age because i was twenty-nine when I did it, and i didn’t want to spend the whole production feeling like I was trying to play a teenager.  I didn’t want that to be my focus. David Tennant as Romeo in the Royal Shakespeare Company’s Romeo and Juliet (2000) - Part Four  

David Tennant on playing Romeo (excerpt from Players of Shakespeare 5: Further Essays in Shakespearean Performance by Players with the Royal Shakespeare Company):

How old did you imagine your Romeo to be?

I think Alex [Gilbreath, who played Juliet] and I both felt we were at the far end of being able to get away with it, but it’s more difficult for Juliet because her age is stated so explicitly. Strictly speaking, Romeo could be any age, in that there’s no textual evidence to suggest exactly how old he is, but of course there’s something in the character which suggests teenage angst and perhaps hotheadedness. I didn’t focus too specifically on an age because i was twenty-nine when I did it, and i didn’t want to spend the whole production feeling like I was trying to play a teenager.  I didn’t want that to be my focus. So I kept it, even to myself, slightly vague. I suppose I thought of him as a young man, and beyond that I didn’t spend too much time worrying about exactly how old he was.
